intro: Senecio obovatus var. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Senecio, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. The leaves are typically narrow and obovate, with a bluish-gray underside. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters called cymes. This plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
